nodes.text: Stass Allie

Stass Allie, a Force-sensitive Tholothian female, was a Jedi Master who lived during the final years of the Galactic Republic. She was also the cousin of Adi Gallia, a fellow Jedi Master and member of the Jedi High Council. Allie became a Jedi General in the Grand Army of the Republic and, gained a seat on the High Council of the Jedi Order late in the Clone Wars.

Allie was killed on the planet Saleucami during the waning hours of the Clone Wars. Having received the command to execute Order 66 from Supreme Chancellor Sheev Palpatine, Clone Commander CC-8826 and another Grand Army clone trooper opened fire on their general, ending the Jedi Master's life.
Biography
Early life

Stass Allie was born on Tholoth prior to the Separatist Crisis. She was found to be Force-sensitive and brought to the Jedi Temple on Coruscant to start her Jedi training. She was eventually granted the title of Jedi Master. She eventually became a member of the Circle of Jedi Healers and served as overseer of the Medical Corps.
Allie was present at Chancellor Palpatine's office with the senator and the Jedi in the debate over whether to take Palpatine's supernatural powers.
Battle of Geonosis

After the Jedi Council received word that Senator Padmé Amidala, Jedi Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi had been captured by the the leaders of the Confederacy of Independent Systems and the Geonosians resulting in a sentence to death, Stass Allie was recruited and joined Mace Windu's Jedi Strike team that were sent to rescue them. She and her fellow Jedi Masters fought valiantly inside the Petranaki Arena against the Separatist Droid Army. Most of the Jedi were killed in the ensuing battle, though Allie managed to survive long enough for the new clone army to arrive, who had arrived to escort the remaining Jedi off the planet in several Republic gunships. She and Bultar Swan, who she had been fighting back to back with, boarded the same gunship and were brought to the desert plain where the battle had spread to. The two shared a nod before they both charged forward to continue fighting the Separatist Droid Army.
Jedi High Council

In 19 BBY,[source?] Stass Allie was granted a seat on the Jedi High Council. Allie served on the Council until the end of the war, present in hologram when Anakin Skywalker was admitted to the Jedi Council, and when Obi-Wan Kenobi was sent to Utapau.
Order 66

Near the end of the Clone Wars, Allie was sent to the desolate planet of Saleucami, located in the Outer Rim, in order to battle Separatist forces. She was accompanied by the 91st Mobile Reconnaissance Corps, which was commanded by the clone commander Neyo, who was also present. Unknown to Allie or any of the other Jedi, the clones had been programmed with inhibitor chips, which forced them to comply[source?] with the execution of Order 66, which meant the extermination of all the Jedi across the galaxy.

As the Order was played on their comlink, Allie, along with Neyo and another clone trooper, were patrolling the bleak and barren landscape of the war-torn planet on BARC speeders in a mop up operation. She was completely caught off guard as Neyo and his wingman fell back behind her and fired upon her speeder repeatedly without hesitation. She was killed instantly as the speeder exploded and was blasted to pieces.
Personality and traits
Stass Allie was a tall, stern woman with indigo eyes and dark skin with green patches. Her brown, scalped head tapered to a point, and eight pale, fleshy tendrils hung down her back.
Powers and abilities

Stass Allie was talented at lightsaber combat and was one of the few survivors of the Battle of Geonosis, the opening battle of the Clone Wars. While her swordsmanship was impressive, her talent for Force healing was more so. She passed down this skill to other Jedi, including Barriss Offee.
Equipment

Stass Allie had a green bladed lightsaber that she used during the Battle of Geonosis. She also wore tall travel boots, a utility belt, a light brown tunic with dark robes, and adorned her scaled scalp with a headdress consisting of a web of thin chains and a brown fabric band which framed her face.
Behind the scenes

The creation of the character of Stass Allie is in many ways a retcon that took place prior to the release of any Attack of the Clones products. The filmmaker intended to use the majority of Jedi High Council members in the film's climactic Battle of Geonosis; however, because most of the film was shot in Australia instead of England, local model Lily Nyamwasa replaced Gin Clarke, who portrayed Adi Gallia in Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace. She filmed all of her scenes wearing Adi Gallia's costume, but the filmmakers eventually realized that she looked too different from Clarke's version of the character, so they created a new character for the film, who became known as Stass Allie.

After the death of Adi Gallia in The Clone Wars, in January 2013 the supervising director for the series, Dave Filoni, stated that the animation team had created a character model for Stass Allie, and that she was to appear in the show in a later season. This never happened, however, before the show was initially cancelled as a result of The Walt Disney Company's purchase of Lucasfilm.

Revenge of the Sith depicts Anakin Skywalker to be the one to utter the line "A partial message was intercepted in a diplomatic packet from the chairman of Utapau." However, Star Wars: The Prequel Trilogy – A Graphic Novel mistakenly depicts Allie as the one to have said the line.
